author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of gold and metal forged beneath the merlin's wing,
Alas, such value doth in uncertainty swing.
Before the Fed's counsel, traders hold dread meeting,
For the cycle of value, time and tide are fleeting.

The black gold of land, a bounty that flows,
Builds strength from last week's gains, in silent throes.
Where merchants pray for guidance, their futures align,
In the hands of central councils, their fates intertwine.

In distant China, a stirring plight unfolds,
Joblessness ascends, as the dragon's tale enfolds.
The third moon has witnessed its unwelcome mark,
In the economy's vessel, a problem stark.

feedItems.title: Metal Prices Fall on Concerns Ahead of Fed Meeting
feedItems.description: Gold and base metals were lower in Europe as concerns weighed about the timing of interest rate cuts ahead of Wednesday’s Fed meeting.

feedItems.title: Oil Builds on Last Week's Gains; Investors Await Fed Guidance
feedItems.description: Oil prices continued to rise after hitting a four-month high last week, with investors turning their focus on a string of key central banks meetings this week.

feedItems.title: China's Economy Has a New Problem: Its Job Market
feedItems.description: Joblessness rose for the third straight month, pointing to pockets of weakness in China’s economy.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In BOJ's counsel, yen seeks for signs,
Yet, it may not soar, MUFG defines.
Gone are rates in the negative zone,
But for yen's rise, no seeds are sown.

Bang & Olufsen, in markets, performs a dance,
Guidance cut, in European lands, found no chance.
From their venture, fruits they reap barely,
In China's realm, hope's flame flickers barely.

Bonds, like rabbits, in the market cower,
Commerzbank speaks of a bearish hour.
From central banks, guidance they seek,
Yet dismal notes might their week make bleak.

feedItems.title: Yen Could Need Signals From BOJ on Future Rate Rises to Gain Significantly
feedItems.description: MUFG said the BOJ’s meeting might not be a decisive turning point in boosting the yen even if the central bank ends negative interest rate policy and yield curve control.

feedItems.title: Bang & Olufsen Cuts Full-Year Guidance
feedItems.description: Bang & Olufsen warned that revenue and earnings for the fiscal year to May 31 would fall short of previous guidance due to a sluggish recovery in key European markets and the lack of a significant recovery in the Chinese economy.

feedItems.title: Bearish Tone Could Prevail in Bond Markets This Week
feedItems.description: Eurozone government bond yields were marginally lower but a bearish tone is expected this week in anticipation of central bank decisions, guidance and a busy supply schedule, Commerzbank Research said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Troubles in realms both near and far,
Air strikes into Afghanistan from Pakistan,
A sinful feast for the carrion crow and tar,
Driven by cross-border militants' plan.

In the land of the rising sun, stocks dost climb,
Led by scribes of circuits and keepers of lands,
The yen doth yield, becoming but a lame mime,
Awaiting the Bank of Japan's commanding hands.

Yet in fair Singapore, a tale of duress and cheer,
Exports of oil-less goods in February did decline,
Yet hope awakes, for recovery appears near,
In this tapestry of trade, a divine, enigmatic sign.

feedItems.title: Pakistan Carries Out Airstrikes Inside Afghanistan
feedItems.description: The bombardment followed attacks in Pakistan that the authorities blamed on militants based across the border.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Rises 2.7%, Led by Electronics, Real-Estate Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in electronics and real-estate stocks, as the yen gave up some of its recent gains ahead of the Bank of Japan’s policy outcome due Tuesday.

feedItems.title: Singapore Exports Drop, But Data Still Show Signs of Recovery
feedItems.description: Singapore’s non-oil domestic exports fell unexpectedly in February, signaling shaky trade momentum at the start of 2024.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of XPeng's rise, a tale I unfold,
As it doth reap the gold, its worth so told.
Like a sea-serpent rises from the brine,
In markets far east, its shares do shine.

In India's realm, Paytm doth quake,
A sudden blow its foundation doth shake.
As hammers strike 'gainst the anvil's grain,
In strife and turmoil, stability wanes.

Yet, foreign coins toward India shift,
On China's shores, they no longer drift.
Yet sudden tempests give pause in kind,
As uncertainty casts shadows o'er the mind.

feedItems.title: XPeng's Shares Rise on Cheaper Brand Launch
feedItems.description: XPeng’s shares rose in Hong Kong after the Chinese electric-vehicle maker disclosed plans to launch a cheaper mass-market brand amid intensified competition in China’s EV market.

feedItems.title: Investors Get a Reminder That India Makes Sudden Moves Too
feedItems.description: India’s Paytm, a pioneer in the country’s shift to mobile payments whose investors have included Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway and China’s Alibaba Group, has been shaken following an order from India’s central bank that largely crippled its banking affiliate.

feedItems.title: Investors Get a Reminder That India Makes Sudden Moves Too
feedItems.description: Foreign investors have increasingly shifted their investments to India from China in recent years, but a recent clampdown on one of its biggest financial technology companies has rattled some nerves.
